page.title: 10A walk around Monks Kirby
page.content: Monks Kirby village is bordered on all sides by farmland.Most of the fields are used for growing crops such as oil_seed rape,barley,oats and wheat. The majority of the fields have hedgerows as opposed to fencing which provide ample refuge for a wide variety of wild life,flowers and grasses.Scattered here and there are a number of small wooded areas which may at one time have been copiced.Owing to natural wastage and possibly Dutch Elm disease there are quite a number of dead trees scattered throughout the hedgerows.On a recent walk the children of Brockhurst Middle School counted 33 dead trees in a relatively small stretch of country lane.Houses in the village are old and of timber beam and brick construction.A number of new houses which make an attempt to blend in have been built recently.
